metadata.Title: CVE-2009-5080 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
The (1) contrib/eqn2graph/eqn2graph.sh, (2)contrib/grap2graph/grap2graph.sh, and (3) contrib/pic2graph/pic2graph.shscripts in GNU troff (aka groff) 1.21 and earlier do not properly handlecertain failed attempts to create temporary directories, which might allowlocal users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on a file ina temporary directory, a different vulnerability than CVE-2004-1296.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-5080` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

groff - 1.22.4-8build1
groff-base - 1.22.4-8build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: groff package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.22.4-8build1').
